intro: Centaurea poikilolepis, commonly known as the variable bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea poikilolepis is known for its adaptability and resilience in arid conditions.
